item.title: Ticket #1173 (Suggestion: xml template functions) updated
item.dc:creator: Denis de Bernardy
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1173 (Suggestion: xml template functions) created
item.dc:creator: Denis de Bernardy
item.description:
it would be nice if, rather than inconsistently calling functions such as:

<?php wp_whatever( $before, $after ); ?> -> returns: html as appropriate

it might be worth exploring xml output for future versions of wordpress:

<?php xml_whatever(); ?> -> returns: <whatever>filters applied</whatever>

so as to xslt transform the result. i think it would be a lot more subtle than anything the template tags currently allow.

item.title: Ticket #1172 (suggestion: wp_admin() template function) updated

item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1172 (suggestion: wp_admin() template function) created
item.dc:creator: Denis de Bernardy
item.description:
wp_admin( bool $include_loginout = false )

should return:

login
logout
  • goto dashboard
  • create new post [def: in this category]
  • create new page [def: with this page as parent]
edit this post
page category author

item.title: Ticket #1171 (Page caching, wp_list_pages and child_of) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1171 (Page caching, wp_list_pages and child_of) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
Currently, using child_of in wp_list_pages only returns the direct children of the passed value rather than the entire subhierarchy below that page.

Example: Page1 -Page2 -Page3 --Page4 -Page5

Calling wp_listpages(child_of=1) yields a listing of Pages 2, 3, and 5. NOT 4.

This can be remedied by using $cache_pages when possible in wp_list_pages() instead of calling get_pages().

Patch submitted.

item.description: Added amended patch using %1$s format for strings with more than one parameter.

item.title: Ticket #1169 (Files not included correctly in wp-feed.php when index.php has been moved) updated
item.dc:creator: roxeteer
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1169 (Files not included correctly in wp-feed.php when index.php has been moved) created
item.dc:creator: roxeteer
item.description:
If you move /wordpress/index.php to /index.php to fix problems with .htaccess mod_rewrite rules, wp-feed.php can't find the files it needs to include. You'll get these error messages:

Warning: main(): Unable to access wp-blog-header.php in /path/to/wordpress/wp-feed.php on line 5

Warning: main(wp-blog-header.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in /path/to/wordpress/wp-feed.php on line 5

Fatal error: main(): Failed opening required 'wp-blog-header.php' (include_path=) in /path/to/wordpress/wp-feed.php on line 5

This can be fixed by adding dirname(FILE) before the file name, just like it's done in wp-blog-header.php. Patched file is included in this report.

item.title: Ticket #1168 (Gettext e-mail messages) updated
item.dc:creator: slebog
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1168 (Gettext e-mail messages) created
item.dc:creator: slebog
item.description:
As reported here -- ​http://comox.textdrive.com/pipermail/wp-polyglots/2005-March/000503.html -- many e-mail messages are not localised via gettext.

I've been through all e-mail messages in WP, and gettexted them, including the existing gettexted ones, to make them all consistent.

Also made sure all e-mails are sent using correct line-endings (CR+LF).

Patch is attached.

item.title: Ticket #1167 (favicon) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: I would be great an option in the admin panel to define a favicon, so all the theme use them. In fact, would be better an option to put whatever you want in the header section, and call them from all the themes.

item.title: Ticket #1166 (Pingbacks don't work with allow_url_fopen=Off) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1166 (Pingbacks don't work with allow_url_fopen=Off) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
pingback_ping() uses @fopen($pagelinkedfrom, 'r') to check if the source URI exists. This check always fails if allow_url_fopen is Off (recommended setting), that means pingbacks don't work.

Please consider replacing this fopen call with something like the code from ​http://7sheaven.pingouin.ca/forum/showthread.php?t=13
